p: Unlike what was observed in the EO, the cytotoxic activity of A. suaveolens, where the synergistic effect of monoterpene compounds and sesquiterpene appears to potentiate the toxicity against the larvae of A. salina, the antimicrobial isolates proved to be the most isolated active compounds (massoialactona) of all the essential oil components [ 34]. However, it is important to note that synergistic or antagonistic effects should not be excluded from antimicrobial activity [ 37].
